p: The observed seasonal meridional migration of precipitation over West Africa is shown in Fig. 3a. Significant precipitation starts at the coast of the Gulf of Guinea at 5°N around March and increases until it peaks in June. This coastal phase is overestimated in all KCM simulations with a narrowing and intensifying wet bias with increasing resolution. The WAM onset is marked by a distinct “jump” of the precipitation maximum from the coastal region to about 10°N with a mean observed onset day of July 2 and a standard deviation of 9.8 days. The major improvements in MR (Fig. 3c) and HR (Fig. 3d) lead to more realistic simulation of this inland rainfall maximum during JAS, while LR (Fig. 3b) always simulates highest rainfall near the coastline.
